newsitem.title: SENEGAL: Senegal proposes foreign minister for U.N. post.
newsitem.headline: Senegal proposes foreign minister for U.N. post.

text.p: Senegal's President Abdou Diouf said on Friday he was proposing his foreign minister Moustapha Niasse for the post of United Nations secretary-general.
Diouf announced his intention to reporters when he returned from the Franco-African summit in Burkina Faso where an African successor to Secretary-General Boutros Boutros-Ghali was discussed.
The United States has vetoed a second term for the Egyptian but left the door open for another African candidate.

"If Africa does not wish to lose its turn we have to act fast," Diouf said. "Some of my brother heads of state asked me if I wouldn't nominate Moustapha Niasse. I see in him the profile of a secretray-general of the United Nations and I have given my endorsement."
